Key Point

The fundamental identity relating hyperbolic functions is:\[\cosh^2x - \sinh^2x \equiv 1.\] This is the hyperbolic function equivalence of the trigonometric identity: \(\cos^2x + \sin^2x \equiv 1\).



Key Point: More hyperbolic identities

\[\begin{align*} \cosh(x+y) &\equiv \cosh x \cosh y+\sinh x \sinh y \\ \sinh(x+y) &\equiv \sinh x \cosh y+\cosh x\sinh y \\ \sinh2x &\equiv 2\sinh x \cosh x \\ \cosh2x &\equiv \cosh^2x+\sinh^2x \equiv 2\cosh^2x-1 \equiv 1+2\sinh^2x \end{align*} \]
